intro: Glandularia kuntzeana, commonly known as the Kuntze's glandular verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant features glandular hairs on its stems and leaves, which secrete oils and contribute to its aromatic properties. Its flowering period typically occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Glandularia kuntzeana is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
